{"step_by_step_thinking": "The relevant documents describe various methods for counting white blood cells (WBCs). The first document discusses the diagnostic utility of WBC and differential cell counts. It highlights the importance of precision in these tests to aid in determining the cause of illness. The second document focuses on quantitative urinalysis, specifically diagnosing urinary tract infections in men. It describes the mean WBC count per millimeter for infected patients as 3.1 x 10^5. The third and fourth documents discuss methods for detecting small numbers of male WBCs circulating in female patients who have received multiple blood transfusions using the polymerase chain reaction (PCR) and an automated differential white blood cell counter, respectively.", "answer_choice": A}
